Description: Any problem regarding the design of the game, like balancing the gameplay. Not a technical detail.
Not planning the game before hand, not documenting the code, artifacts or game plan.
Any problem with tools like engines, APIs, development kits, third-party software, etc.
Problems with the team code/assets infra-structure.
Any problem regarding testing the game.
When there are too many bugs in the game/engine or any failure in the game design or technical issues.
Lack of or no prototyping phase nor validation of the gameplay/feature.
Planning too many features that end up impossible to implement it in a reasonable time.
Adding non planned new features to the game during its implementation.
Cutting features previously planned because some other factor like short deadlines.
Problems regarding any delay in the production.
When developers continuously spent extra hours working in the project.
Problems regarding communication with the any stakeholder.
Problems in setting up the team, lost of professionals during the development or outsourcing.
Project costed more money than expected.
When there is more than one project being developed at the same time.
Problems involving too much time planing/scheduling or lack of it.
Problems regarding leaked assets.
Problems regarding marketing/advertising
Problems with the process used to generate revenue from a video game product.
